reviews.review_msg: Worth delaying your graduation to take his lectures. Took 320, 321 and 420 with him. You will gain a much deeper understanding of accounting just by attending his lectures. Questions are encouraged and he answers them flawlessly. The course material is brutal but he somehow makes it interesting. Amazing lecturer and a wonderful human being

Robin is one of the best profs out there, defo take a class with him if you can. Grade is mostly based on exams, which are very time-constrained with low averages. To practice, do the end of chapter questions based on the stuff he tells you to study (very transparent with exams). Keep doing it over and over until you can do it quickly & correctly!

She has little knowledge of M&A or any of the other topics she teaches, she uses hypothetical scenarios to create her own problems which would never occur in real life. Her lectures are extremely difficult to follow given she speaks in such random and various tones.

Stay as far away as possible, unless you want to be docked randomly

She really cares and is really nice but wow, this is a difficult course. Her exams are on the harder end but since it's curved it balances out. Make sure to do her examples and the homework. She explains the concepts and her examples really well in class and answers questions..

She's a nice person but her exams has too many surprises. One minute you're doing consolidations, next minute she's asking you to calculate ratios on the exam, like ??  The questions are also super long so there isn't enough time. If you think you can beat the curve then go for it, I just wouldn't want to do it again.
